questions.question: A vector with one arrowhead represents __________ and __________. Two arrowheads represents __________ and __________. Three arrowheads represents __________ and __________.
questions.answer: Heading and TAS. Track and GS. Wind direction and wind speed.

questions.question: Drift is the angular distance between __________ and __________.

To maintain constant track we need to angle into the wind by an amount equal to the __________. This is called the __________. It's important not to confuse this with the __________, which is the angle between track and __________.
questions.answer: Drift. Wind Correction Angle. Wind Angle. Wind direction.

questions.question: If you're correcting for (right/left) drift, your right wingtip will be forward. If you're correcting for (right/left) drift, your left wingtip will be forward.
What are the three factors that determine the amount of drift?
questions.answer: Wind angle relative to track (greater angle = greater drift). Wind speed (greater speed = greater drift). TAS (slower TAS = greater drift).

questions.question: __________ drift is calculated during pre-flight planning. __________ drift is experienced during flight.
Calculate WCA, HDG and GS for: planned track 280°T, wind 320° at 20kt, TAS 110kt.
Calculate WCA, HDG, and GS for: planned track 260°T, wind 140°T at 30kt, TAS 140kt.
What types of wind velocities are reported in °T, and which are reported in °M?
questions.answer: °T = Meteorological reports (METAR, TAF). °M = Air Traffic Service reports.
